Then a few years ago, while she was struggling with what proved to be a terminal illness, she asked that I make the trip. Go to Ireland, she said, and tell me everything.

title: London: The Rockwell
description: THE BASICS

title: What Young Designers Dream Of
description: THE design studies known as concept cars, which are staples at auto shows and often inspirations for the cars of tomorrow, are also test beds for new ideas. The newest designers in an automakers studio often have a hand in these  with ideas that spring from creative young minds to become dream-car matter.

title: Sound Effect
description: Karim Rashid has never been one to turn the volume down on any project  except perhaps on the new range of sound-absorbing wall panels he designed for the Swedish furniture company Offecct. Rashid says he has always been interested in sound-dampening strategies, having been to one too many restaurants where I cannot hear my dinner guests. The Soundwave Flo tiles, made of molded recyclable polyester fiber, can be installed on walls or ceilings to help silence the busy bote downstairs or your own heavy-metal jam sessions. Available in four colors (including a decidedly loud fuchsia) at offecct.se.

title: Theyre Playing Around With the Past
description: THE set for Conversations in Tusculum looks like no set at all.

title: Rescue Me: A Fed Bailout Crosses a Line
description: WHAT are the consequences of a world in which regulators rescue even the financial institutions whose recklessness and greed helped create the titanic credit mess we are in? Will the consequences be an even weaker currency, rampant inflation, a continuation of the slow bleed that we have witnessed at banks and brokerage firms for the past year?

title: Public Infidelity, Private Debate: Not My Husband (Right?)
description: WHAT type of infidelity is forgivable in a marriage? What triggers an exit strategy?

title: The Rising Cost of Maintenance
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters: Teaching to the Testosterone
description: Let us grant  just for the sake of argument  that the idea that boys and girls learn differently has some kind of truth attached to it (Elizabeth Weil, March 2). In all other things, we praise diversity in the classroom. Should boys not be exposed to the experience of girls learning differently, and vice versa? And how are boys and girls to learn how to interact with members of the opposite sex  as they will all their working lives  if they are denied the experience in their formative years?

title: Barbecue for Brunch
description: Jeff Matros, co-owner of Memphis Maes, a popular barbecue bistro in Croton-on-Hudson, attended the New Orleans Jazz and Heritage Festival 19 years in a row. He adored the music, he said, but he has just as fond memories of the citys food.

title: Eddie Izzards Master Plan
description: EDDIE IZZARDS metaphors dont sit still, onstage or off; they leap into the conversation with an almost physical presence, even when hes simply describing how tough it is for a comic to be accepted as a dramatic actor. If you arrive in comedy, he said, the studios wont let you get off that horse. You have to shoot it, you have to kill it, you have to Bill Murray kill it, boom! and he mimes shooting a horse as he explains, Bill Murray successfully did that so he could get to the dramatic place he wanted to be; he really had to kill that Ghostbusters place.

title: The View From the Catbird Seat
description: FORGET location. In real estate, the secret may be timing, timing, timing.

title: Obsessions: Fir Fetish
description: A friend Of Mine In Idaho Recently Tore Down His House And Is Constructing a new one on its footprint. The funny thing is that the old house looked new and the new house will look old, because he is building it with reclaimed wood.

title: Buddys Back
description: I TELL you, you put on those glasses and something takes over you, said Pat McRoberts, who is starring in the Westchester Broadway Theaters production of Buddy: The Buddy Holly Story. He is referring, of course, to Hollys signature dark horn-rimmed glasses, part of the early-geek look that made it so surprising when the singer opened his mouth and brought forth such effortlessly hard-hitting rock n roll.

title: How to Be a Man
description: The prospect of reading a novel narrated in run-on sentences, fragments, Spanish phrases and street slang might seem daunting, but not when you meet the precocious, Holden Caulfieldesque narrator of Dagoberto Gilbs coming-of-age novel. Set during the weeks leading up to the 1992 Los Angeles riots, The Flowers follows Sonny Bravo as he adjusts to life in his new stepfathers apartment building, Los Flores. As he becomes embroiled in the lives of the other tenants, Sonny makes the mistake of believing hes wise beyond his years and has the world figured out. Soon enough, though, he begins to have his doubts, resisting and then succumbing to temptations like lying, theft and prejudice as he goes about learning how to be a man.

title: Grand Jester
description: Casino de Madrid is one of the Spanish capitals most traditional members clubs, housed in an august building with a musty neo-Gothic library, sweeping staircases, painted vaulted ceilings and heavy-lidded patrons who look like they havent stirred from their well-worn sofas since the institution was founded in 1836. On the top floor, however, in the recently reopened La Terraza del Casino restaurant, the atmosphere is somewhat different.

title: A Tour for the Times, Seeking Deals Among the Repossessed
description: TRAVERSE CITY, Mich.  Most of the houses on the real estate tour in and around this quaint resort town on Lake Michigan were in fairly good condition, empty and scrubbed clean of the sort of things that might bring to mind the previous owners.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: Comedy

title: The Big Bang
description: Style Map | Bangkok

title: With Race Likely to Continue After Pennsylvania, Democrats Court Other States
description: PLAINFIELD, Ind.  The Pennsylvania primary may be the next stop along the turbulent road to the Democratic presidential nomination, but the epic battle between Senators Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama will almost certainly not be settled there.

title: Emonomics
description: For years, the ideology of free markets bestrode the world, bending politics as well as economics to its core assumption: market forces produce the best solution to any problem. But these days, even Bill Gates says capitalisms work is unsatisfactory for one-third of humanity, and not even Hillary Clinton supports Bill Clintons 1990s trade pacts.

title: Robin Troy, Michael Stromberg
description: Elizabeth Delafield Troy and Michael Joseph Stromberg were married on Saturday at Talmadge Hill Community Church in Darien, Conn. The Rev. Michael Zeman, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony.

title: The Housewives Are Now Desesperadas
description: THERES a new Gabrielle Solis on the American airwaves, but this desperate housewife prefers to be called Gabriela. And she speaks Spanish all the time.

title: Alluring Scent and Taste, Too
description: Insolia, a minor grape farmed mainly in western Sicily, yields a rich, dry white wine with a captivating bitter-orange scent, grapefruit-like zestiness and nutty flavor.

title: Wild and Crazy Guys
description: Call it the Gang Theory of history: the idea that a number of charismatic revolutionaries coalesce and together grab power and attention, overturn orthodoxies and remake their time. Its an alluring idea, and well suited to describing the dynamics of scenes and subcultures of, say, cooks or comedians. The best Gang Theorists focus not just on iconic figures but on the connections between them. For every telegenic chef there are a thousand anonymous immigrant cooks chopping alone, sweating the onions, changing everything; for every lauded late-night comedian, a thousand funnymen of the night shift, scratching by the hours with a ballpoint pen and a spiral-bound notebook, cracking up the security guard. Capturing this breadth, revealing the crummy details before the Gang gets its due, is what makes a lasting work of Gang Theory; its not just the number of characters that matters, but the depth and quality of the time spent with them, and the subtleties and candor of the stories they tell.

title: The Amazing Race, as Played in the Lab
description: WHAT do reality TV shows like Survivor and Americas Next Top Model have in common with an insurgent method of stimulating useful innovations around the world?

title: Web Help for Cruisers After Special Treatment
description: Cruisers who like the finer things  be they luxury ships like Cunards new Queen Victoria, with its two-story library and theater with private boxed seats; or the more intimate yachts of SeaDream that cater to your every whim and can zip in and out of tiny ports; or boutique itineraries like Frances wine regions or the Arabian Peninsula  need no longer sift through hundreds of listings to find their fantasy cruise. Last month, Cruise Critic, a consumer Web site owned by TripAdvisor, added a new luxury-cruise link.

title: Regional Theaters: The More the Merrier
description: To the Editor:

title: For Steel Magnolias, a Return to Stage Roots
description: I dont know if Kelly Bishop has a fan club, but I may start one. From the first time I saw her, as the brittle Sheila in the first Broadway production of A Chorus Line (for which she won a well-deserved Tony Award), through her seven television seasons as Emily Gilmore, self-assured rich Hartford lady, on Gilmore Girls, Ms. Bishop exudes the kind of cool, matter-of-fact confidence that eludes most of us. And here she is, at the Paper Mill Playhouse, playing Clairee in a likable new production of Robert Harlings Steel Magnolias.

title: Drug Maker Stays Close to Doctors and Patients
Breakfast Is Served, All Day
description: The oversize cushions on the window-side banquettes at Rosie are so inviting, you may end up spending an afternoon perched on one  an especially tempting notion since the door by the counter provides easy access to reading material at the adjacent Elm Street Books. But its what is written on the chalkboards on the pale stucco walls  a menu that spans breakfast, lunch and a fair portion of dinner  that draws most customers to Rosie.

title: The New Order
description: For those of you who were out of the room the last time I discussed this subject, let me repeat one more time: modern does not equal cold and sterile. Modern can  and should  be as richly textured as it is rational and ordered. The apartment shown here, in the United Nations Plaza (the pair of swank towers designed by Harrison, Abramovitz and Harris in the 1960s), is a rewarding case in point. Its owners, Benjamin Pardo and David Gresham, are passionate, as well as informed, about design, and it shows. The nearly 1,700-square-foot apartment, which was given a thoughtful renovation by Joe DUrso, is filled with a profusion of modernist and contemporary furniture and objects  from Saarinen to Sottsass  that in lesser hands would look cluttered.

title: Panthers Hitting Stride at Just the Right Time
description: On their first two possessions in the Big East tournament championship game Saturday night at Madison Square Garden, the Pittsburgh Panthers turned the ball over to Georgetown. How could they handle the pressure if they could not even handle the ball?

title: Stories From a World in Motion
description: IT seems fair to say that in the world today there are not many stories bigger or more complicated than the movement of large groups of people from one country to another. And yet, perhaps because it is so vast and complex, it is a story that can be comprehended only in its fine-grained, human particulars. A timeworn piece of Hollywood wisdom (occasionally attributed to Dostoevsky, John Gardner or some other writer) holds that every narrative arises from one of two situations: Someone goes on a journey, or a stranger comes to town. The immigrants story, in its basic form, fulfills both of these archetypes. An individual or a family leaves a familiar world, by either choice, necessity or some perceived combination of the two, and arrives in a place that is as strange to the newcomers as they are to it.

title: Fooled Again
description: WITH a few computer keystrokes last week at my request, Jack Begg, the supervisor of newsroom research at The Times, showed me that there was no record of a Margaret B. Jones in Eugene, Ore. With a few more keystrokes, he brought up property records showing that the house Jones said she owned was bought by Margaret Seltzer and another person in 2000 and now belongs to Stuart and Gay Seltzer after an intrafamily transaction.

title: Young and in the Way
description: After the 2004 presidential election, an amusing graphic made its way around the Internet. It took the red state/blue state divide to the extreme, showing two new nations on the North American continent. Canada and most of the coastal states became the United States of Canada. The heartland became Jesusland.

title: Thinking Twice About the No. 2
description: Washington

title: Jessica Zeldin, Johnston Whitman Jr.
description: Jessica Zeldin and Johnston de Forest Whitman Jr. are to be married on Sunday in Beaver Creek, Colo. The Rev. Don Bissett, a Baptist minister, will perform a nondenominational ceremony at the Beaver Creek Chapel.

title: Drug Tests as a Window on Workers
description: The Quest Diagnostics Drug Testing Index is hardly a portrait of the general population. Rather, it includes a better-behaving subset: those who are applying for jobs at places that test for drugs or who hold jobs where they know they may be tested randomly. That said, the index offers up some interesting nuggets.

title: Dear(est) Abby
description: Here you are, a celebrated indie actress, playing Abigail Adams in the new HBO miniseries, John Adams, which begins tonight and could lend a new glamour to Colonial-era America. What do you think of Abigail? I really admire her. She is the founding father of first ladies.

title: The Intelligence Cover-Up
description: For more than two years now, Congress, the news media, current and former national security officials, think tanks and academic institutions have been engaged in a profound debate over how to modernize the law governing electronic spying to keep pace with technology. We keep hoping President Bush will join in.

title: In a Town House, a Private Exhibit
description: To the Editor:

title: Letter: Glamorizing Taggers
description: To the Editor: As a frequent traveler to Berlin and many other cities, I have to wonder what the Travel section thinks it is doing in "One Wall Down, Thousands to Paint" (March 2) by glamorizing a man who leaves his mark on a telephone booth, a dozen doors and a concrete wall next to the train tracks.

title: Woe Be Gone
description: It is a short but laborious book, and it begins: Ours are ominous times. Each nervous glance portends some potential disaster. Paranoia most mornings shocks us to wakefulness, and we totter out under the ghostly sun. At night fear agitates the darkness.

title: Ex-Jersey City Mayor Eyes Return to City Hall
description: JERSEY CITY

title: Design Heavy|Definitive Prouv
description: For those of you who can only dream about owning a piece of Jean Prouvs furniture, here is a book that at least provides a comprehensive (if pricey) look at his oeuvre, both design and architectural. Jean Prouv ($250), is a handsomely produced, slipcased two-volume set that is co-published by Galerie Patrick Seguin in Paris and the Sonnabend Gallery in New York; the two galleries collaborated on a Prouv exhibition in 2003. Profusely illustrated, it also includes essays by design and architectural historians, a biography (really more of a chronology) by Prouvs daughter Catherine and interviews with design luminaries like Azzedine Alaa, Marc Newson and Renzo Piano, who speaks affectingly of his long friendship with the master.

title: Can Sealy Catch Up With the Foam Set?
description: Less than two months after conceding that 2007 financial results did not meet expectations, the chairman and chief executive of the Sealy Corporation, David J. McIlquham, resigned last week, effective immediately.

title: Costly to Drive, Painful to Pay
description: London

title: The Steep Price of Our Forbidden Kiss
description: THE rules forbade me from being within three feet of him. I knew those rules; he knew them. Sharing a drink meant coming a yard too close. But I wanted to touch something of his, to claim my territory. So with an inch of his ale remaining, I reached for Thomass glass and said, Let me have a sip.

title: Jet Makes Connection in Creativity With Youths
description: WASHINGTON  The first time Kris Jenkins walked into the studio at Life Pieces to Masterpieces, the room instantly went quiet.

title: Asian Fusion
description: If someone were to boast to you that his house took an army of architects to design, you might assume that the outcome would be the domestic equivalent of the Tower of Babel. But for the Thai artist Rirkrit Tiravanija, the more is indeed the merrier. As an artist, Tiravanija is a catalyst for human interaction; his work revolves playfully around things like food, music and, more often than not, architecture. In 1997 he recreated Philip Johnsons Glass House at half-scale and installed it in the sculpture garden of the Museum of Modern Art as an art studio for children. Two years later, he created a full-scale replica of his own East Village apartment at Gavin Browns Enterprise on West 15th Street, complete with a bedroom and a working kitchen and bathroom. The apartment was open 24 hours a day to anyone who cared to stop by for a home-cooked meal, a nap or a shower.

title: Jagged Edge
description: Last June, among the slick, limited-edition minimalist and staid blue-chip vintage pieces at Design Miami/Basel, the locally based Chart Foundation showed a group of 1980s furniture designs that were notable for their raw, awkward energy and sharp social and aesthetic commentary. The most striking of these was a chair by the Zurich architect Stefan Zwicky. A sly poke at Le Corbusiers famous Grand Confort chair, with its shiny tubular steel frame embracing fat leather cushions, Zwickys version is rendered in unforgiving concrete and framed in crude steel reinforcing bar. Provocative and gleefully anti-functional, it brought back memories of that heady, subversive decade in which seemingly anything went.

title: Comedy at the Edge
description: After Lenny

title: Tunnel Visions
description: A COUPLE of days before Christmas, when my 9-year-old son couldnt sleep, I thought he was excited about our forthcoming vacation.

title: Reformers Gain in Iran Vote Despite Being Barred
description: TEHRAN  With about half of the races for Parliament decided Saturday, more than 30 reformers appear to have won seats although most of their most prominent members had been barred from running by the countrys conservative establishment.

title: Wait, Werent These the Safer Bets?
description: UNLIKE such ill-starred peers as Countrywide Credit or Ameriquest, Thornburg Mortgage was supposed to have been a different kind of home loan company: one that didnt make so-called Ninja loans (no income, no job, no assets) or engage in any of the other risky practices that led to the subprime debt debacle.

title: Crews Prepare to Remove Fallen Manhattan Crane
description: Emergency crews prepared to remove the wreckage of a gigantic crane from the remains of smashed buildings on the East Side of Manhattan on Sunday afternoon, a day after it toppled across a city block, killing at least four construction workers, including the crane operator, and injuring more than a dozen others.

title: New Flights to Toronto for New Yorkers
description: By the end of this month, travelers flying between the New York area and Toronto will no longer have to make the 40-minute trek from the Lester B. Pearson Airport into downtown Toronto. Porter Airlines (www.flyporter.com), a regional passenger carrier with a downtown hub at City Center Airport, will expand its service to include Newark Liberty International Airport starting March 31.

title: Patch, Patch, Patch: The Art of Quilting Finally Gets Its Due
description: Its football team may have had a disappointing season, but the University of Nebraska can now brag about its world-class quilt museum. The Lincoln campuss International Quilt Study Center and Museum was designed by Robert A. M. Stern Architects and largely funded by Robert and Ardis James, a couple from Chappaqua, N.Y., who have been collecting quilts for decades.

title: Blown Away | Glass On The Move
description: Glass was a popular material at Design Miami in December, appearing in exhibitions like Fragiles (with work by designers such as Arne Quinze and Jerszy Seymour) and in shimmering cast-glass benches by Tokujin Yoshioka. But the event also offered the opportunity to see designers  including the Campana brothers and Matali Crasset  actually make objects at a traveling outdoor glass-blowing studio. GlassLAB, as it is called, resulted from a collaboration between the architect and product designer Paul Haigh,

title: With Return of Mold, Students Are Displaced
description: GREENWICH

title: Fans and Players Try to Adjust After a Storm-Tossed Night
description: ATLANTA, March 15  Only 400 Tennessee fans were allowed into the 9,191-seat Alexander Memorial Coliseum, but Bruce Pearls father, Bernie, was determined to make them sound like 4,000.

title: A Bad Plan for Armonk
description: To the Editor:

title: Catastrophic Failure Leads to Seat Recall
description: WHEN the federal government announced last month that one million Evenflo Discovery child seats were being recalled because they could come apart in a side-impact crash, there was a strange twist: The government insisted on a recall even though there is no standard that specifies how well such seats must protect children in a side crash.

title: Zoe and Lenny Kravitz | Actor and Designer/Musician
description: Some rock stars like to destroy hotel rooms, but Lenny Kravitz opts to design them instead. His firm, Kravitz Design Inc., brings a camera-ready, retro-inspired flash to everything it does. He has collaborated with Swarovski to make a blinged-out, Art Deco-inspired chandelier called Casino Royale and even lent his signature touch to a recording studio for the Setai Group. Most recently, he redesigned the lounge at the Delano Hotel in Miamis South Beach. His inspiration? My aunt had a place in her house, he says, where everyone played, hung out, listened to music and where all the fun was had. With that in mind, Kravitz kept the spaces aesthetic close to home, complete with a replica of his own Lucite grand piano. His daughter, Zoe, is an acting student, with two movies coming out this year. Those who wonder about her design sensibilities are in luck: the 19-year-old is about to move into her first apartment.

title: When Is a Heart Attack Not a Heart Attack?
description: 1. Symptoms

title: Inside the List
description: THE JORDAN CHRONICLES: For any one individual to be beautiful, young, rich, successful, popular, wholly amoral, have passed no exams and sell books by the million is more than many can endure. It seems so unfair. Thats the novelist Fay Weldon, writing in The Times of London about Jordan  a k a Katie Price  a former topless Page 3 model in the tabloid paper The Sun whose life is followed in Britains gossip magazines the way Britneys is here. (Jordan recently made headlines by having her surgically enlarged breasts reduced: 32G to 32D.)

title: Up Front
description: People sometimes call me a public intellectual, Scott McLemee once wrote, which is probably a euphemism  a polite way around the fact that I have no degrees, no institutionally recognizable field of specialization and, indeed, no credentials of any kind.

title: Postfeminism and Other Fairy Tales
description: PERHAPS it was the Iron my shirt! hecklers. Or maybe it was Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, the object of those hecklers, having to defend her likability. Or the resonance of her proxy, Amy Poehler, being shut out in the Saturday Night Live spoofs of the Democratic debates. Or last week, the spectacle of yet another male politician admitting he had betrayed his wife, while she stood clubbed beside him  and male commentators talked about his patronizing of prostitutes as a victimless crime.

title: Growing Cheers for the Home-Schooled Team
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  Taber Spani, one of the best high school girls basketball players in the nation, holds hands with two opponents as a coach reads a Bible verse. It is the way each game in the National Christian Homeschool Basketball Championships begins.

title: Leaving Behind the Trucker Hat
description: Tivoli, N.Y.

title: The Pimps Slaves
description: Reading between the sheets, the world of Kristen and Eliot Spitzer may seem relatively benign. She may have been abused as a child, and tangled with drugs and homelessness, but she was also a consenting adult who apparently kept half the cash that customers paid for her.

title: The Book of James
description: In the beginning, there was Beard, Julia Child famously declared about the paterfamilias of American cooking, an opinion echoed in one way or another by almost all of her contemporaries. And while James Beard is often criticized for having ended an otherwise exemplary career in a blaze of corporate sponsorship  his ample pear-shaped frame and zealous grin on perhaps too many food labels  his legacy remains largely undiminished. As David Kamp writes in The United States of Arugula, Beard, along with Child and Craig Claiborne, transformed the notion of cooking from a homemakers chore to a cultural pastime. Without Beard, its doubtful that cooking today would be considered an American art.

title: U.C.L.A. Claims Title and Quickly Sets Its Sights Higher
description: LOS ANGELES  First, U.C.L.A. won the regular-season championship in the Pacific-10, considered one of the nations best conferences. On Saturday, it won the conference tournament by beating second-seeded Stanford for the third time this season.

title: Importing a Decongestant for Midtown Streets
description: HAWTHORNE, N.Y.

title: Hells Kitchen Getting Cooler With Its First Luxury Hotel
description: In Hells Kitchen, the Midtown Manhattan neighborhood west of Times Square, its rare these days to spot the mobsters, prostitutes and even desperate actor/waiters who used to populate its streets and tenement buildings. Now its officially called Clinton and full of investment bankers and wine bars. And starting this summer, the formerly seedy neighborhood will get its first major luxury hotel.

title: Its Car Time in New York
description: THIS years New York International Auto Show has much in common with the going-nowhere Knicks: both will focus on rookies in the hope of improving next season.

title: Scent Notes: Eau de Mies
description: Perfumes have structures just as buildings do, and many perfumers, like many architects, have imbibed modernisms early-20th-century precepts: eliminate ornament, simplify line, derive form from contemporary materials.

title: At the Sharpe James Trial, a Slim Show of Support
description: Newark

title: A Crash Course in Online Gossip
description: THE post that appeared on a Juicy Campus message board on Feb. 25 was blunt and decidedly extracurricular.

title: Datebook
description: NEW ORLEANS

title: Dearth of a Nation
description: First, a confession: Im British.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: FILM

title: Investigators Seek Records of Spitzer Campaigns Payments to a Consultant
description: Federal authorities are seeking records involving payments to a political fund-raising consultant to Gov. Eliot Spitzer as part of their criminal investigation, according to two people with direct knowledge of the inquiry.

title: The Undercover Parent
description: Ridgewood, N.J.

title: With More News of Abuse, a Harder Search for Homes for Pit Bulls
description: Briarcliff

title: Correction: A Long Wharf-Quinnipiac Partnership
description: An article on March 2 about the partnership between Long Wharf Theater in New Haven and Quinnipiac University in Hamden omitted part of a quotation by Crystal Brian, the chairwoman of Quinnipiacs visual and performing arts department. She said, "This is a dream thats long been in the minds and hearts of the universitys College of Liberal Arts.

title: Polar Opposites
description: SAM BRANSON, the 22-year-old musician, sometime male model, friend of Princes William and Harry and son of the Virgin Group billionaire Richard Branson, was on familiar turf: ordering Kobe beef tartare at Ono, an elegant Japanese restaurant in the meatpacking district.

title: Rich, Rare Adventures in Other Times and Places
description: It can happen anywhere. For me, it was in a high school history class, where I met Akhenaton and Nefertiti. The initial attraction was visual, but once the artworks had sparked my imagination, I got hooked on the connection to an exciting, near-mythical place.

title: Barry Diller Conquered. Now He Tries to Divide.
description: WHEN Jim Collins, author of Good to Great, a guidebook for corporate makeovers, spoke at an executive retreat two years ago for IAC/InterActiveCorp, the companys founder, Barry Diller, took advantage of the occasion to poke fun at himself.

title: Upstarts Could Shake Up Status Quo in A.L. East
description: It hasnt always been this way; it only seems like it: the Yankees and the Red Sox finishing one-two in the American League East, in whichever order, and each reaching the playoffs, one as the division champion, the other as the wild card.

title: Start Writing the Eulogies for Print Encyclopedias
description: IT has never been easier to read up on a favorite topic, whether its an obscure philosophy, a tiny insect or an overexposed pop star. Just dont count on being able to thumb through the printed pages of an encyclopedia to do it.

title: Soothsayer to Mets Wont Brush Off Signs
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Andrea Malliss devotion to baseball is otherworldly. She charts her favorite teams pitchers, except her focus is not the location of their fastballs but of Jupiter in their planetary houses.

title: Return of the Rock Lobsters
description: A HARSH wind is blowing around the four members of the B-52s as they view Lower Manhattan from a seventh-floor observation balcony at the New Museum, which rises over a nearby flophouse on a gentrifying stretch of the Bowery. From this height, they can see every newly opened bar, cafe and boutique. The neighborhood didnt look anything like this, said the guitarist Keith Strickland, 54, referring to the late 1970s, when these new wave pioneers from Athens, Ga., first conquered the downtown rock scene. I walked out this morning and said, Where am I?

title: Paris: 1728
description: The restaurant 1728 is more than a place to eat. It was here that the Marquis de Lafayette spent his winters during the last seven years of his life, receiving a stream of visitors every day and holding informal soirees every Tuesday evening at 8.

title: Source Material
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats the Real Racial Divide?
description: When old-time Democrats in Washington reminisce about the days of brokered conventions  floor fights and frantic early-morning calls, deals cut under the haze of cigar smoke  they talk about them the way a paleontologist might describe the hurtling stride of a velociraptor: an awesome spectacle, to be sure, but not one you would really want to see up close. Last week, Democrats woke up to find that the unthinkable may be upon them. There might still be an unforeseen turn in the titanic clash between Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama, but the way it looks now, the outcome will probably rest with the partys nearly 800 superdelegates, many of whom will no doubt expect to be bribed and beseeched by both campaigns. If thats the case, there is about as much chance of settling the issue before the convention as there is of, say, Obama waking up one morning and deciding that hope is kind of a dumb slogan after all.

title: So Much for Good Intentions
description: WHAT matters most now is not how we entered Iraq, but how we leave it. If we leave behind an Iraq more stable and less threatening to its neighbors than the one we toppled, I think the intelligence communitys (and my own) mistakes about Iraqs weapons of mass destruction, the Bush administrations exaggerations of that threat and its baseless insistence on links between Iraq and Al Qaeda will all lose their edge  even though they will not, and should not, be forgotten.

title: Events Stars: Monster and Woods
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  On a March day 46 years ago, a prominent Miami golfer named Frank Strafaci stood behind the hotel at Doral Country Club looking west at the wind-whipped lake bordering the 18th hole. It was during the inaugural Doral Country Club Open Invitational that Strafaci, the events first tournament director, said of the 18th, That hole is a monster  a blue monster!

title: The Ting Dynasty
description: When Peter Ting was a young man studying at the Farnham School of Art, near Surrey, England, he immersed himself in the tradition of British studio pottery and handmade ceramics. There he was influenced, if indirectly, by the work of the renowned 20th-century ceramicist Bernard Leach, a pioneer of the honestly made object. Leach, like Ting, was born in the Far East and spent time in Japan before founding his own pottery studio in England. Several of Leachs disciples taught at Farnham, and Ting was so inspired he traveled to Japan to visit Shoji Hamada, who was Leachs friend and collaborator. Leachs ability to embrace both the Japanese and the British approaches to pottery resonated with Ting: The East-West style fits into the way I look at the world.

title: Whats Left
description: For any American citizen with faith in the possibility of progressive reform, these are exciting times. Of late, the Democratic presidential campaigns have often had the air of revival meetings. It will be no surprise, of course, if the Republicans continue to beat the drums of fear and resentment; one does not abandon an orientation so tried and true. (Social science research shows that the candidate who pushes the fear button most tends to have an advantage.) But who could have expected such a change of temper on the other side? Who knew that the old rhetoric of progress, of facing the future with confidence, still had such appeal?

title: Dipping Carefully Into the Betting Pool
description: Q. The N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament starts this week, and your colleagues have asked you to participate in an officewide pool. Is this a good idea?

title: Obsessed (Agog, Beset, Consumed, Driven, etc.)
description: The categorical imperative means something quite different, but it does sound like the right term for the self-protective psychological urge that drove Peter Mark Roget (1779-1869), creator of the Thesaurus, to classify and categorize all manner of things over a long lifetime. Madness did not just run in his family; it galloped, sped, sprinted, dashed and made haste. If the title of Joshua Kendalls fine new biography of Roget has a clinical Oliver Sacks feel, the material pretty much justifies it.

title: For an Easter Feast That Says Italian
description: In the Italian countryside outside Naples where Michelina Lombardi raised her young family, Easter was celebrated with pizza rustica, a savory, oven-baked pie layered with prosciutto, soppressata, pancetta, eggs and sheeps-milk cheeses. Today Mrs. Lombardi, known as Mamma, her son Guy and his eight siblings carry on the tradition at Lombardis Market.

title: Twombly in the Land of Michelangelo
description: ROME

title: Events in Westchester
description: Comedy

title: Riding Emotion and Exertion, Georgia Sweeps Into Final
description: ATLANTA  Dennis Felton, the Georgia mens basketball coach, left Alexander Memorial Coliseum at 3 p.m. Saturday worried that his team would be too drained to play later that night against Mississippi State in the semifinals of the Southeastern Conference tournament.

title: An Assistant Who May Need the Occasional Battery
description: POINT-AND-CLICK devices have long controlled computer screens. But soon they may also control some household robots that can trundle around living rooms, doing useful jobs.

title: Long Before Nascar, Dirt-Road Daredevils
description: HOWARD KROPLICKs fascination for local history has led him into lots of musty library archives, looking for the Long Island that predated suburbia.

title: Tibetans Clash With Chinese Police in Second City
description: BEIJING  Thousands of Buddhist monks and other Tibetans clashed with the riot police in a second Chinese city on Saturday, while the authorities said they had regained control of the Tibetan capital, Lhasa, a day after a rampaging mob ransacked shops and set fire to cars and storefronts in a deadly riot.

title: Small Club Now Claims Paterson as Member
description: New Yorks last accidental governor was Martin H. Glynn, in 1913. The latest, David A. Paterson, wont find that precedent much comfort.

title: Softly Treading Between Taste and Art
description: SENSATIONAL single-owner auctions, in which the contents of Princess Dianas closet, Bill Blasss apartment or Ellen Barkins jewelry cases are put on the block, inspire no end of covetousness.

title: Museum Quality | A Totally Modern Sink
description: When the sculpture garden by Philip Johnson opened at the Museum of Modern Art in 1953, the paving stones of cloudy Carrara marble were meant to last forever. Unfortunately, during the museums recent renovation, many of the marble slabs broke. And since the original stone was no longer available, the entire lot had to be replaced. Enter Gil Shapiro and his design company Urban Archaeology in TriBeCa. Vintage marble from the Modern is not something he could pass up, so Shapiro bought all 600 remaining slabs, each measuring 30 inches by 58 inches. The slabs have since been used to decorate pools, garden paths, fancy loft buildings in TriBeCa and even bathrooms. The Shapiro-designed MoMA Stone Washstand is now available to order from Urban Archaeologys salvage collection.

title: Letters: The Lippi Scandal
description: To the Editor: In the Next Stop column about Prato, Italy, "In Tuscany, the Revealing of a Forbidden Love" (March 2), Pratos so-called favorite scandal would have benefited with a few additional facts about the Renaissance painter Fra Filippo Lippi.

title: Correction: The Boss | Teamworks Rewards
description: The Boss column on Feb. 24, about Dan Schulman, chief executive of Virgin Mobile USA, referred incompletely to his role in the founding of the company. While he was the first chief executive in 2001, work on setting up the company had begun more than a year earlier.

title: With Text-Messaging Ban While Driving, Legislators Play Gizmo Catch-Up
description: STEPHEN M. SWEENEY is a New Jersey state senator, and, like other busy people in a hurry-up world, is loaded down with several cellphones and wireless hand-held devices like BlackBerrys  gizmos for multitaskers on the move.

title: When a Co-op Board Beats the Bushes
description: Q At a recent annual shareholders meeting, my co-op had a vote to increase the flip tax. To pass such a change would require the affirmative vote of two-thirds of all outstanding shares. The tally was about eight percentage points short of the necessary 66.67 percent.

title: Habitat Forming
description: The architect Sam Trimble has worked with some tough customers, the restaurateurs Robert De Niro and Michael Jordan among them. But these were nothing compared to the three orphaned grizzly bears for whom he has been commissioned to design a habitat in Alaska. They might act like teddy bears, but they could devour you, Trimble says. And probably would if you got too close. Getting (safely) close to the animals was just one of Trimbles directives in creating the Bears of Alaska Discovery Center, an educational facility outside Anchorage. He was also asked to include a walk-in freezer for storing moose meat and an exhibition space for teaching humans bear safety. Trimbles design, both environmentally and animal friendly, is an homage to indigenous Eskimo architecture, which he says is the ultimate in sustainable green living: planted roof, locally sourced timbers, natural light and heat retention. No doubt Patron and JB (siblings whose mother was shot) and Hugo (who was found limp after trying to eat a porcupine) will feel at home.

title: Departure Lounge to Nowhere
description: IF the Jetsons had flown Trans World Airlines, they would have felt at home in its terminal at Kennedy Airport, a swooping, birdlike concrete building, designed by the architect Eero Saarinen, that fed its passengers out to their gates through dreamlike, windowless white tubes. The departure lounges were similarly futuristic: glassy flared cabins, outfitted with curving banquettes, padded sectional tables, and a rounded desk for the gate attendant.

title: They Were High Jinks Then. Now, Its Different.
description: WHILE jogging through our tranquil Westchester neighborhood the other day, I came upon a case of empty Bud Light bottles strewn across a neighbors lawn. It was a jarring sight. The neighborhood is a tidy collection of mostly modest homes, and people take considerable pains to present their property in a favorable light.

title: Terrible Rumble, and Then Chaos as Crane Fell
description: At first it was just a noise, a rumble and a roar that brought terrified residents to their windows and stopped pedestrians cold. A massive white construction crane swayed for a few breathless moments in the mid-March breeze, and then toppled.

title: Correction: In the Kitchen for a Party and a Chefs Lessons
description: A listing of chefs with an article on cooking parties last Sunday misstated the price charged by Kate Staley for parties of two to six. It is $160 a person, not $120.

title: Oil Tank? More Like a Subterranean Monster
description: HOUSES, like people, tend to live double lives. They, too, have a visible existence and an invisible existence, a seen life and an unseen life. In the latter are those hidden systems, the pipes in the walls, the wiring, all that lies concealed between the sheathing and the Sheetrock. At our house, the most ominous of these unseen features is the oil tank buried just out past the porch.

title: 36 Hours in Pasadena, Calif.
description: NESTLED in the San Gabriel Valley just 10 miles northeast of Los Angeles, Pasadena harbors a distinct, if at times chauvinistic sense of individual self. Its old-money past continues to flourish in the form of grand mansions and a vast array of museums and gardens, many underwritten by prominent local families. And newer money has helped transform Old Pasadena, in decline for many years, into an energetic shopping and dining destination, with quirky shops and new restaurants. But it is the expansive outdoors, mountain views and fine climate (except in August, when you could fry a hot dog at the Rose Bowl) that still make Pasadena, the famed City of Roses, a shining jewel of Southern California and an enduring object of jealousy.

title: Neighborhood Watch
description: No matter how shiny and safe a city gets, no matter how high its housing prices climb, how fast its crime rates fall and how many of its corner stores are turned into buzz-before-entering boutiques dedicated to clothing the urban baby or are replaced by franchised coffee shops with WiFi hot spots for laptop-toting Beat poets, there is one sort of room at the citys very core whose design schemes rarely shift upscale and whose typical occupants  be they real or fictional  resist much gentrification of the soul, let alone beautification of the hair. The walls of such rooms are dull, their lights are harsh, and hunkered down in most of them are a jittery suspect and two clever cops, one of whom tends to act hostile and volatile, the other one solicitous and calm. Over this trio hangs a plain round clock.

title: Good Vibrations
description: All winter, when I should have been sleeping, I was reading perfume blogs. I would lose myself in a sybaritic rapture, the clock on my screen racing toward morning as I played a bait-and-switch game with my senses, taking in words that describe smells by calling on images, textures, music. The sensory pileup felt good. The blogs tell me that scents ring, sing and lash out in fury; they also cradle, buffer, withhold. I believe them.

title: Correction: The Softer Side of Wrestlings Showman Extraordinaire
description: Because of an editing error, an article on March 2 about Vince McMahon, chairman of World Wrestling Entertainment Inc., misstated his age and that of his wife, Linda, when they met. He was 16 and she was 13, not the other way around.

title: Letters: How Do You Prove Youre a Jew?
description: After reading Gershom Gorenbergs compelling article (March 2), I was left wondering whether I was meant to feel uplifted at the ultimate successes Gorenberg profiled or dismayed at the bureaucratic hurdles faced by non-Orthodox Israelis unable to have a civil marriage.

title: An Enterprise Built for Speed Is Shifting Its Focus to a Green Future
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Barely a century after the advent of automobile racing, technology has developed so much that the sport is no longer simply about achieving raw speed.

title: Sir Mix A Lot
description: Alexander von Vegesack was only 15 when he made his first acquisitions, at a Cairo bazaar: a Turkish coffeepot and an African spear, among other things. But throughout his career as a design historian and the director of the Vitra Design Museum, von Vegesack never lost his fascination with everyday things. Its the glue that holds together the 2,000 objects and furnishings hes collected over the past four decades, and also a new exhibition at the Pinacoteca Giovanni e Marella Agnelli in Turin, Italy. Adventures With Objects celebrates the collectors life and travels, and his obsession with the relationship between industry and traditional crafts. The usual suspects are here  Achille Castiglioni, Charlotte Perriand, Gerrit Rietveld. But so are leather saddles and a Navajo blanket. To understand the connection of all these different things is to understand my biography, von Vegesack says.

title: Spains Many Muslims Face Dearth of Mosques
description: LLEIDA, Spain  As prayer time approached on a chilly Friday afternoon and men drifted toward the mosque on North Street, Hocine Kouitene hauled open its huge steel doors.

title: Peaked Roofs, Crossed Fingers
description: THERE was great excitement last fall in the part of Brooklyn known affectionately as Victorian Flatbush when the citys Landmarks Preservation Commission recommended that Midwood Park and Fiske Terrace, two neighborhoods within this network of communities south of Prospect Park, be designated a historic district.

title: In a Time of Distracted Ears, Teachers Ensure Theyre Loud and Clear
description: MILLBURN, N.J.  Rene Slater used to give herself laryngitis trying to talk over the incessant hum of the ventilation unit in her classroom here at Wyoming Elementary School, and her second-grade students still complained they could not hear.

title: From Palatial Home to Retail Palace
description: RALPH LAUREN will soon rebuild its two-story building at the southwest corner of Madison Avenue and 72nd Street, opposite the well-known Ralph Lauren flagship store in the mansion across the avenue. The new store will be the third structure to occupy the southwest corner, whose complicated history began with a McKim, Mead & White mansion in 1894.

title: Corrections
description: Editor's Note

title: For Mexicans, Bureaucracy on the Move
description: THE setting was the gymnasium of a Childrens Aid Society community center on East 101st Street in Spanish Harlem, where a half-dozen ragged lines of men and women stretched the length of the room.

title: Eco Mania: L. A.'s Renewable Resource
description: John Brady and Willard Ford know that consuming less is one way to cut your carbon footprint. Nevertheless, the two former bike racers joined forces in 2006 to open the FordBrady design gallery in downtown Los Angeles, with the explicit purpose of selling furniture. Much of that furniture, however, is made from materials destined for landfills or incineration. Their finds, including the benches produced by the Thai company Osisu from compressed milk cartons and reclaimed teak, or the Fast Forward Chair by Chulaphun Chulanond (above), have attracted clients like the architects Marmol Radziner, Graft Lab and Ray Kappe. Even the showroom  in a former theater on the edge of Chinatown  abides by this philosophy of reuse. A FordBrady line of outdoor furniture is in the works.

title: Paint by Numbers
description: When artists started using paint straight from the can in the 1960s and early 70s, they forfeited their personal take on color and gave themselves over to the dictates of the mass market. Color Chart: Reinventing Color, 1950 to Today, a new show at the Museum of Modern Art through May 12 (sponsored, appropriately enough, by Benjamin Moore), looks at the start of what became a color revolution. With the arrival of fast-drying acrylics and other mass-produced paints heavily marketed to a nation of do-it-yourselfers, art began to resemble a ready-made commodity, taking its hues from packaging, billboards, magazines and comic strips.

title: JPMorgan Acts to Buy Ailing Bear Stearns at Huge Discount
description: Bear Stearns, pushed to the brink of bankruptcy by what amounted to a run on the bank, agreed late Sunday to sell itself to JPMorgan Chase for a mere $2 a share, narrowly averting a collapse that threatened to cascade through the financial system.

title: Correction: The Week Ahead: March 9  15
description: A classical entry in the Week Ahead report last Sunday about a recital by the pianist Garrick Ohlsson misidentified the composer of a piano sonata. It is Justin Dello Joio  not Norman Dello Joio, his father.

title: Officers Firings Prompt Calls for Chief to Resign
description: MADISON

title: West Yonkers, Budding Biotech Center?
description: WHEN companies like Alexander Smith & Sons Carpet abandoned Yonkers in the 1950s and 60s, thousands of blue-collar workers lost their jobs, and a once-throbbing industrial section of the citys west side was left to deteriorate.

title: Supreme Court Inc.
description: I.

title: Theres No Freedom Gene
description: THE mantra of the antiwar left  Bush lied, people died  so dominates the debate about the run-up to the Iraq war that it has obscured real issues that deserve examination. After all, for those of us who supported the war, rebutting arguments about weapons of mass destruction has become reflexive. We point to all the United Nations Security Council resolutions, the International Atomic Energy Agency statements, the C.I.A. analyses, the Silberman-Robb report, the Senate Intelligence Committee findings  if we were wrong, we were in good and honest company.

title: Maps of All Sorts Charting Mind and Space
description: Like many words in the English language, cartography comes from a Greek root, in this case chartis, meaning map, and graphein, meaning write. Mapmaking as a kind of writing is a theme that is explored in The Map Show at the Rockland Center for the Arts. It is one of the more striking shows in this space, which has a vigorous art school and exhibition program.

title: Soft Shoe in Hard Times
description: WASHINGTON

title: In the Clinton-Obama Race, Its the Pollster vs. the Ad Man
description: DEMOCRATS tend to make celebrities of their campaign consultants, which is why anyone who has closely followed this presidential campaign could probably pick out Mark Penn or David Axelrod, the chief strategists for Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama, in a bar. To refer generically to these strategists as consultants, however, as if they were necessarily experts in the same craft, is to obscure important differences in how they got to where they are.

title: Sophisticated Takeout
description: At Harvest Cart in Jersey City, the bounty is in the form of fresh soups, sandwiches and entrees. The menu at this takeout shop, which opened in October, may be straightforward, with entries like roasted chicken and meatloaf, but theres a subtle sophistication to the food. Meatloaf, for instance, is served with house-made tomato chutney.

title: The Emperors Club of Rockaway Boulevard
description: THERE are four storefronts at 116-02 Rockaway Boulevard, a squat brick building on a quiet corner in South Ozone Park, Queens. One is a coin laundry, another is a plumber and two are empty, though there are traces of a previous tenant, like an orange sticker with the words Alter Ego (its a hair product) or a small sign advertising the defunct Posh Hair and Nails Salon.

title: Profile in Style: Philippe Starck
description: his design dna

title: Salutations
description: Ladies and gentlemen:

title: When Clemens Touched a Family Touched by 9/11
description: In the middle of the Roger Clemens furor, somebody sent me an e-mail message over the transom about Clemens and a young man who died on 9/11. It also involves Brian Cashman, the general manager of the Yankees, who performed a mitzvah of major league grace. The story goes like this:

title: Sag Harbor Factory Was Part of History
description: To the Editor:

title: An Eco-Trend Moves Out of the Wilderness
description: HURRYING down the teak staircase of the Old Bangkok Inn, already late for a dinner party across town, I asked Joey, the young man behind the reception desk, to hail me a cab. You could take a taxi, but it will be slow ... and boring, he said, citing Bangkoks notorious traffic problems. Or, he said, with a glint in his eye, you could have an adventure!

title: The Nets Help Themselves With a Second Straight Victory
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Nets have picked a good time to start playing some of their best basketball of the season.

title: The Great Parade of Easter Devotion
description: IF youre in Mexico City this Easter, dont expect to find too many painted eggs or chocolate bunnies. Instead, the Easter season in this city, home to one of the largest populations of Catholics of any city, is marked by intense religious activity, altars overflowing with flowers and processions that range from the inspirational to the carnivalesque.

title: McCain Visits Iraq to Meet With Officials
description: BAGHDAD  Senator John McCain arrived in Iraq on Sunday on a trip that was billed as a visit by an official Congressional delegation but which also served to promote his foreign policy credentials as he campaigns for the White House.

title: Something (Good) for Everyone
description: WILL SAVARESE, executive chef at the noisy new Tap House, in Tuckahoe, was until recently chef at the far more tranquil La Crmaillre, in Banksville. The two restaurants  the first offering a loose, New American menu that features a burger for $9.50, the second coddling diners with Maine lobster and morels in an anise cream sauce at market price (if you have to ask ... )  could not be more different.

title: At Xanadu, a Huge Pepsi Sign Decreed
description: St. Louis is marked by its Gateway Arch, Paris has the Eiffel Tower. New Jersey is about to get a 287-foot-high billboard for Pepsi.

title: Correction: Can You Beat the Market? Its a $100 Billion Question
description: The Strategies column last Sunday, about the cost of active investing, misstated the expense ratio of the retail version of the Vanguard Total Stock Market Index fund. In its most recent report in February, Vanguard said the expense ratio was 0.15 percent, not 0.19 percent.

title: Soaring to a Long-Awaited Championship
description: The Pittsburgh Panthers fancy themselves as New York Citys basketball team.

title: Socket to Me
description: When I first saw the 85 Bulbs Chandelier, by Rody Graumans for Droog, in 1993, I was immediately attracted by the efficient way it achieved its simple shape using nothing but bare essentials  some wire, some sockets and light bulbs. I was less attracted to its not so humble price of $3,000. Normally I prefer good cheap products over good expensive ones; besides being easy on the wallet, a low price makes them more difficult to design and thus more admirable. But when I renovated my studio five years later and it turned out that I still loved it, I bit the bullet. After 10 years it is still the centerpiece of our meeting room and has not aged a bit. I have never tired of its quiet wit, and incredibly, even though I had originally purchased matching replacement light bulbs, in 10 years of usage not one of its 85 bulbs has ever burned out.

title: Megan Crane, Jeffrey Johnson
description: Megan Crane, a daughter of Anne G. Crane and Thomas R. Crane Jr. of Ridgewood, N.J., was married yesterday to Jeffrey Shane Johnson, a son of Karen Wood of Kihei, Hawaii, on the island of Maui. Daniel Panosian, who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa in Dana Point, Calif. Mr. Panosians wife, Elena, who also became a Universal Life minister, participated.

title: The Double Life of a High-Priced Call Girl
description: This article has been revised to remove errors, in accordance with the appended Editors Note.

title: Several People Are Injured at Chinese Consulate Protest
description: A demonstration in front of the Chinese consulate in Midtown Manhattan briefly turned violent on Saturday morning, with protesters throwing rocks at the building as police officers tried to get them off the street, according to demonstrators and the police.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Pit Bulls Are a Breed

title: In SoHos Shadow
description: If a shopping excursion to mark the start of spring on Thursday takes you to NoLIta, it is worth remembering that the neighborhood, like its neighbor SoHo, is rich in attractive restaurants.

title: Must a New Owner Return a Security Deposit?
description: Q A year and a half ago, I signed a one-year lease on an apartment in Manhattan and gave the landlord a security deposit. About halfway into the lease, the building was sold to a new owner.

title: Off The Dribble
description: Trial by Fire

title: Correction: Will the Heist Work? Will the Movie?
description: A picture caption on March 2 with an article about heist films misidentified the man shown with Alain Delon in a still from Le Cercle Rouge. He is Jean-Pierre Janic  not Yves Montand, who portrays a former policeman involved in a jewelry heist.

title: Departing Foster Care, Arriving at Independence
description: MARY BROWN and Dawnae Silvia are at pivotal points in their lives: Ms. Brown is about to leave New York Citys foster care system, and Ms. Silvia has just done so.

title: Cabrera to Fight 3-Game Ban
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The symbolic importance of starting on opening day at Yankee Stadium is not lost on Melky Cabrera. He has never done it, but he expects to do so March 31 and plans to fight his three-game suspension.

title: Forget Iowa. How About That Antarctica Vote?
description: LONDON  They call themselves residents of the 51st State, which is a broad territory that covers all continents, counts around six million Americans and displays a passionate interest in the Democratic match-up between Senators Barack Obama and Hillary Rodham Clinton.

title: The Interrogator
description: The contemporary espionage thriller has mostly belonged to the boys. Some are ex-intelligence  John le Carr, Charles McCarry. Others, like Alan Furst, are researchers with verve. But in the last decade, female novelists in the Furst mold  Gayle Lynds, Francine Mathews and others  have infiltrated the inner circle. Perhaps the most decisive breakthrough came with the spy novels of Stella Rimington, the first female head of Britains MI5, who has written two more thrillers since At Risk appeared in 2004.

title: Feeling That Heartbreak Again
description: By the time Becky Barta sings Walkin After Midnight, the third number in Always ... Patsy Cline, at the Engeman Theater in Northport, everything is all right. Its all right that she doesnt sound exactly like Cline. Its all right that shes more performerish than the woman she is impersonating. Its all right that she exudes less heat. She has a pleasant vocal style all her own.

title: The Population of Americas Prisons
description: To the Editor:

title: Where Leasing Beats Selling
description: EVEN as Asbury Park scrambles to regain momentum for the housing portion of its oceanfront redevelopment, which was stalled in midwinter by the real estate credit crunch, nearby Long Branch cruises into spring with 216 new seaside rental units about to hit the market.

title: O Salo Mio
description: For most real estate buyers, provenance counts. Special architectural flourishes, prior celebrity ownership, even anecdotal tales of happy years lived in a placid space add bonus value. When the photographer and fashion plate Manuela Pavesi came across a villa 20 minutes outside of her primary residence in Mantua, Italy, she was beguiled by its history  although it was of a somewhat less conventional nature. Her new digs were the scene of imprisonment, rape, torture, coprophilia, sexual enslavement, mutilation and murder.

title: Transgressions
description: Barry Lygas new novel, Boy Toy, takes one of the more uncomfortable themes of young adult literature  a sexual relationship between an adult and a minor  and pushes it past the genres farthest boundaries. This is an upsetting, intense, intricately drawn portrait of the fallout from a 12-year-old boys involvement with his seventh-grade teacher.

title: Sara Anderson, Byrne Huddleston
description: Sara Paris Anderson and Thomas Byrne Huddleston Jr. were married Saturday at Williamsburg Presbyterian Church in Virginia. The Rev. Neil M. Stevenson performed the ceremony.

title: To a Middle Schools Three Rs, Add an S: Skateboarding
description: Merrick

title: Who Knew? Kewpie Lady Had Quite a Colorful Life
description: A RECENT raw winters day found my husband hunched in the glow of his laptop, browsing the New Yorker archives. He was enjoying an article on the vibrant arts scene in Westport in 1925 when, suddenly, he groaned. I dont believe it. That Kewpie lady, Rose ONeill. She lived in Westport, too!

title: For Youngsters, Leaps and Boundaries
description: SUBTLE and earthy, in hues of green, brown and gray, the West 110th Street Playground at the north end of Central Park has little of the overt cheer associated with childrens spaces. Four adjoining circular areas, echoing the curve of the boulders jutting up beyond its south side and the airiness of the ferns dotting the terrain, offer sparse, space-agey climbing and spinning equipment with movable parts that wobble and sway, threatening to send a child tumbling. Beneath it all, springy rubber matting undulates like a grassy knoll.

title: Heidi Brody, Lawrence Suss
description: Heidi Gail Brody and Lawrence Craig Suss are to be married Sunday afternoon at Fox Hollow, a catering center in Woodbury, N.Y. Rabbi Jeffrey Rappoport is to officiate.

title: Too Heavy a Hand
description: AFTER defeating the Taliban dictatorship in Afghanistan and replacing it with a fledgling democracy, the Bush administration turned its attention to the risk that Saddam Husseins Iraq was thought to pose to a nation still reeling from the attacks of 9/11.

title: Cyclists Ordeal May Help Bonds
description: When the cyclist Tammy Thomas goes on trial next week on charges she lied to a federal grand jury about whether she used performance-enhancing drugs, Barry Bondss lawyers will be monitoring the case from the legal equivalent of the on-deck circle.

title: For France, an All-Purpose Heartthrob
description: PARIS

title: Studying the Footprints of a Governor-to-Be
description: On Monday, through a twist that few could have foreseen, Lt. Gov. David A. Paterson will be sworn in as the 55th governor of New York  an accidental governor thrust into a position of extraordinary power by the sudden, gaudy downfall of his former running mate, Eliot Spitzer.

title: Hot or Not
description: David Lehmans anthology The Best American Erotic Poems is actually two anthologies. The first is a sampler of faultless poems about sex by dead Americans like Walt Whitman, Emily Dickinson, Robert Frost, Gertrude Stein and Wallace Stevens. There are some nice, smart, surprising choices: William Carlos Williamss Young Sycamore rather than his better-known Queen Annes Lace, and Frosts savage poem The Subverted Flower. A few dead Americans famous for doing things other than writing great erotic poems, like Francis Scott Key and Emma Lazarus, make an appearance; their poems are neither great nor really very erotic. As with many anthologies, you cant believe the exclusions: nothing by Marianne Moore? No H. D.? What about Edwin Arlington Robinsons Eros Turannos? Now thats a great, even a really great, poem, and, as its title suggests, its also pretty erotic.

title: Stamford Will Close K-5 Magnet School
description: STAMFORD

title: Woods Makes a Charge, But Five Share the Lead
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Sudden as wind shear, Tiger Woods burst into the picture at the Arnold Palmer Invitational on Saturday. He forced his way up the crowded leader board with a charge reminiscent of the tournaments namesake, birdieing the three most difficult holes at the Bay Hill Club and shooting a 66 that left him tied for the lead with four others at six under par.

title: Shelf Life
description: TALL ORDER: A BOOKCASE WITH HEIGHT, USED ALONE OR IN MULTIPLES, CAN CREATE STRIKING ARCHITECTURAL ELEMENTS IN A SPACE.

title: Stomach Problems and an Upset for a Favorite in Central Park
description: For world-class runners, the lesson of the day is that when they go after $10,000 first prizes on a Saturday, they should be extra careful what they eat two days before, especially smoked salmon and cream cheese. Alan Webb and Shalane Flanagan had stomach problems after Thursdays news conference and lunch and emerged with mixed results in their races in Central Park.

title: Yankees and Rays Meet, and a Game Breaks Out
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Yankees and the Tampa Bay Rays played a peaceful exhibition game on Saturday, at last. For Shelley Duncan and Melky Cabrera, a new fight has begun.

title: A Year Later, Lives Still Upended by a Storms Damage
description: LODI

title: Tornadoes Tear Through Downtown Atlanta
description: ATLANTA  A powerful tornado struck directly at the commercial center of downtown Atlanta on Friday night, blowing windows out of dozens of high-rise buildings, tossing trees and cars, and severely damaging many of the citys landmarks, including the CNN Center, the Georgia Dome and the convention center.

title: And the Stars Raved
description: LOS ANGELES

title: Top Dogs Ills Get Their Fix: Less Bark and No Bite
description: When the Ireland Chamber in the United States lost the featured speaker for its 12th annual St. Patricks Day Governors Breakfast, scheduled for Monday, the events organizers knew just whom to call.

title: Reflections on the Invasion of Iraq
description: To mark this weeks fifth anniversary of the invasion of Iraq, the Op-Ed page asked nine experts on military and foreign affairs to reflect on their attitudes in the spring of 2003 and to comment on the one aspect of the war that most surprised them or that they wished they had considered in the prewar debate.

title: Newer Immigrants Taking Over Diners
description: FAIRVIEW

title: Shelter and Fire Islands Try Device to Kill Ticks
description: SHELTER ISLAND has used deer hunts to try to control its tick problem. Pesticides have been sprayed there and on Fire Island, where disease-carrying ticks are also persistent.

title: I Feel Good
description: Why do horses snort? Sometimes, at the approach of a stranger or the appearance of a plane high above the pasture, a horse will widen its eyes, flare its nostrils and send a stuttering column of air out into the world. On other occasions, horses have been known to snort for no reason besides their own boredom. By suddenly creating a sound, the slack-minded horse elicits an automatic startle response  flooding its brain with chemicals, delivering a jolt of excitement and relieving, at least for a moment, the monotony of a long day in an empty field. The horse has in effect fooled its own nervous system  and benefited from the self-deceit.

title: For Democrats, Increased Fears of a Long Fight
description: WASHINGTON  Lacking a clear route to the selection of a Democratic presidential nominee, the partys uncommitted superdelegates say they are growing increasingly concerned about the risks of a prolonged fight between Senators Hillary Rodham Clinton and Barack Obama, and perplexed about how to resolve the conflict.

title: U.N. Urges Iraq to Address Human Rights During Lull
description: BAGHDAD  The United Nations on Saturday called on the Iraqi government and the United States to take advantage of a period of reduced attacks to address the human rights problems that plague Iraq, including violence against civilians, abuse of detainees, persecution of women and ethnic minorities, and a lack of food and shelter for displaced people.

title: Traded Players Who Will Not Trade Places
description: Fans complain that todays athletes have no loyalty to the clubs or cities they play for. Yet last month, when five players on the last-place Maple Leafs refused to waive no-trade clauses in their contracts so they could stay in Toronto, they were criticized for supposedly putting their own interest ahead of the teams.

title: Miata Talk: Mazda Puts a Lid on It
description: TESTED 2008 Mazda MX-5 Miata Grand Touring PRHT

title: City Closes Stage Deli Again
description: Citing many health violations, including a severe vermin infestation, the city Department of Health and Mental Hygiene has again closed down the Stage Deli, almost two years after it was closed for similar violations.

title: Display Tactic | Window Treatments
description: A new project from the Italian luxury goods company Tods gives fresh meaning to the art of window-shopping. Curated by the Italian design impresario Giulio Cappellini and Diego Della Valle, the president of the Tods Group, the windows at select boutiques this spring will undergo a museum-worthy makeover courtesy of some of todays coolest design stars. Theyve enlisted Ineke Hans from the Netherlands, BarberOsgerby from England and the Frenchman Patrick Norguet, whose multicolored shelves (left) were inspired by his famous Rainbow chair. No word yet if Zaha Hadid will be doing the shoe display.

title: New Link in a Fusion Chain
description: THE new Republic Grill Asian Bistro in Stamford is the latest outpost in a mini-empire, stretching from Westport to Darien to Greenwich. Elsewhere, the Asian fusion group calls itself Tengda. But despite a similar menu, cooking style and management, the new Stamford place has opted to change what is already a winning name.

title: 3 Area Winners in Intel Contest
description: Three students from New Jersey and Long Island finished among the top 10 winners in the annual Intel Science Talent Search.

title: Karla Villatoro and Benjamin Friedman
description: Karla Xiomara Villatoro, a daughter of Rosa Emilia Villatoro of Houston and Jose Luis Villatoro of San Miguel, El Salvador, is to be married on Sunday to Benjamin David Friedman, a son of Judge Judith A. Friedman and Edward B. Friedman of Pittsburgh. Rabbi Ranon Teller will officiate at the Omni Houston Hotel.

title: Congress in Recess
description: MY greatest surprise was the failure on the part of Congress to assert itself before the executive branch. That failure assured continued problems for the military in the face of a secretary of defense who proved incompetent at fighting war.

title: Bad Plugs, Rust and More
description: CARS, even the high-end models, are not perfect, and the steady release of technical service bulletins by automakers detailing their mechanical problems is a reminder of that imperfect world. The latest bulletins include Hyundais and Hondas, and also a Jaguar that is having difficulties with spark plugs.

title: Phillip Lloyd Powell, Furniture Designer, Is Dead at 88
description: Phillip Lloyd Powell, a self-taught furniture designer who, working largely out of the public eye, produced elegant, sculptural pieces that are today highly prized by collectors, died on Sunday in Langhorne, Pa. He was 88 and lived in New Hope, Pa.

title: In-Store | The Perfect Mix
description: 1. His quirky, high-concept Williamsburg design store may be called the Future Perfect, but for David Alhadeff, perfect doesnt have to mean precious. I strive to be the sweet spot where art, design and craft intersect, and while I do carry some big-ticket items, its never about the money. He recently opened an even more democratic home shop next door called A & G Merch. Its like a cooler Crate and Barrel. Go to thefutureperfect.com and aandgmerch.com.

title: Rumors Reasons
description: In the summer of 2004, Andy Martin, a colorful Web columnist and sometime Republican candidate for state office, put out a press release announcing his sadness at having to expose Barack Obama as a Muslim who has concealed his religion. Reporters ignored Martins charge, which offered no proof. But the story took root: Martins screed bounced about blogs, mutating over the course of a couple years into an e-mail message that suggested the senator is a kind of Muslim Manchurian candidate for the White House.

title: Arrr!
description: The resurrection of fictions most popular characters  in novels like Geraldine Brookss Pulitzer Prize-winning March and Donald McCaigs Rhett Butlers People  has become a popular genre in recent times. But these books, with their well-polished 21st-century prose, have little in common with Edward Chupacks Silver, a scabrous reimagining of the life of Robert Louis Stevensons famous creation. Instead, this witty romp resembles nothing so much as George Macdonald Frasers Flashman novels, with their deliberately antique 19th-century style. Like Flashman, Long John Silver makes no apologies for his behavior. And, like Fraser, Chupack makes no belated attempts to find heroism in an antihero.

title: A Master Before the Age of 10, but Not Without a Mild Debate
description: A San Francisco boy has become the youngest master in United States history, but the achievement has come with some criticism.

title: Scaling Back on Partying, Miller Lands Back on Top
description: BORMIO, Italy  A shot of tequila was on the bar as Bode Miller, a champion once more, sat for an interview.

title: For Foreign Investors, Profit Isnt Only Goal
description: BRIAN GOULDING recently moved with his wife, Majella, and three young children to Wilmington, N.C. Its gorgeous here, he said, referring to the regions temperate climate.

title: Aliza Rabin and David Honig
description: Dr. Aliza Rabin and David Paul Honig are to be married on Sunday afternoon at the Hilton Pearl River in Pearl River, N.Y. Rabbi Jonathan I. Rosenblatt will officiate.

title: Lagerfeld Digest
description: Karl Lagerfelds interest in architecture isnt limited to his many houses, as two new books of his architectural photographs so elegantly illustrate. Karl Lagerfeld: Three Examples of 20th Century Modern Architecture is a heavy-duty boxed set showcasing three of the most distinctive buildings in the world: Curzio Malapartes Casa Malaparte, Peruginis La Casa Albero Nella Pineta di Fregene and Tadao Andos Vitra Conference Pavilion. Konkret Abstrakt Gesehen, on the other hand, finds our ponytailed polymath taking grainy, abstracted shots of sidewalk cracks, staircases and other fragments of urban existence. Despite his passion for architecture, Lagerfeld suggests that he has no plans to design a house any time soon: Fashion, photography, books. Thats all.

title: Letter: Stereotyping Asian Women
description: To the Editor: Regarding "Amazing Grace: The Art and Ordeal of the Kimono" (March 2): I was rather disappointed to see a Japanese kimono school referred to, by an acquaintance of the author, as a geisha school. These schools are, rather, designed for women across the spectrum of Japanese society who wear kimonos for weddings, festivals, tea ceremonies and numerous other occasions.

title: Correction: Enter the Boosters, Bearing Theaters
description: An article last Sunday about the nationwide building boom of regional theaters omitted an architect who helped design the Dee and Charles Wyly Theater in Dallas. Besides Rem Koolhaas, it was also designed by Joshua Prince-Ramus.

title: Brogues Progress
description: The husband-and-wife designers Jonathan Levien and Nipa Doshi have become famous for their melding of English austerity with Indian vibrancy (see their Charpoy collection for Moroso). But their newest project, a collaboration with the venerable English shoemaker John Lobb Ltd., is decidedly more Anglo. Realizing that reinventing the shoe was out of the question, their company, Doshi Levien, named the project Apprentice in deference to the master cobblers time-honored techniques. Their designs subtly tweak traditional handmade details: a scalloped cutaway side panel here, a traditional English brogue whose perforations snake around the shoe there. Bowler hats not included.

title: Crane Collapses on Manhattans East Side, Killing 4
description: A crane towering over a high-rise construction site on the East Side of Manhattan collapsed in a roar of rending steel Saturday afternoon, raining death and destruction across a city block as it slashed down on an apartment building, broke into sections, crushed a town house and cut away a tenement facade.

title: Coda for a Musical Home
description: JUST before he turned 30, Duncan Sheik, the singer and composer, bought a 2,400-square-foot bare loft in a condominium at 195 Hudson Street, a block below Canal Street. That was in 1999, long before the latest real estate boom, and the price was just a bit over $850,000.

title: Let the Healing Begin
description: BY last summer, it was clear that Mary Ellen and Earl Forte needed to move to a more accessible place.

title: Kiki Smith On A Roll
description: Kiki Smith, who is known for her artistic explorations of the natural world, is no stranger to the domestic one; she has designed multiples for the Fabric Workshop and Museum and decorative glass objects for Steuben. Smiths latest foray is the Maiden & Moonflower wallpaper for Studio Printworks, a company known for its collaborations with contemporary artists. The hand-printed wallpaper, which comes in six color combinations, depicts a woman standing under a tree, surrounded by nocturnal animals and stars. And, the better to protect the real natural world, this PVC-free paper is printed with water-based inks. Go to studioprint works.com.

title: Playing in China, Chipping at a Wall
